TopicTitle: You must use the object that is in your left hand to survive a thermonuclear war

Articles.Content:
a piece of solid glue that was peeled off of duct tape that i use as a minor stress reducer?

used it to not be bored as the blast vaporizes my corpse (unless i become a ghoul like in Fallout which is unlikely)
My chin. I could hit people with it.

An IPad

ISmack

A device that allows my spirit to possess objects when i die

DANCE MINIONS DANCE
a history book....Well at least i can say i knew a lot of WWI ,and WWII.
Air well at least I don't have to breathe the toxic air, wait....
It's always my laptop. My right hand is usually busy holding my head.
a pen.... well I guess I can write letters?...
My hair.... dangit.

My cheek.

Well.... I guess it's useful for like... protection....

the June issue of National Geographic.

At least i'll die a gentleman and a scholar.

A cup of tea...

Die in a classy way, gentlemens
My face. Again. Why u never carry anything else, hand?
An iPad time to google a fallout bunker.
carpet... I can live in style?
Quartz crystal. Wonder if I can do something fancy with radiation. Who knows.
A condom. Possibly the least form of protection I will need
My right arm... It's always useful to have one of these, but they're not the best radiation shielding.
My water bottle..... Some portable water storage to store safe water should be useful in thermonuke war where everything is radioactive
Some pen that doesn't work anymore... I'm dead.
my face... um I can... ah I got nothing....
My physics lab book, at least I will know what angle to aim at so I hit anyone that comes too close.

A vinyl record of The Rainbow Factory

Who know? Maybe I will only find a turnable?
my face.... again....

The DIN A6 exercise book in which I write down what I have to do as homework...
